page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
{ SUCKLEY, OLD STORRIDGE AND BIRCHWOOD
The area is situated in the County of Hereford and Worcester, the nearest town being Malvern. The village of{Suckley}(the name means 'Valley of the Bird Song') is fragmented, with the hamlets of {Longley Green}and{Lulsley}forming the main population areas. Longley Green ('long road between the greens') is a ribbon development of black and white cottages and an old chapel, with infilling of modern bungalows. {Cradley Brook}flows in a northerly direction and joins other small brooks to form the{Leigh Brook. Batchelor's {Bridge,}where the water courses join, was washed away in 1924 and was rebuilt in the following year.
